{{Infobox Montreal Metro |station= [[File:Cadillac (logo).svg|300px]] |image=[[File:CadillacStationMetro.jpg|300px]] |borough = [[MercierâHochelaga-Maisonneuve]] |city = [[Montreal]] |inaugurated=6 June 1976 |line=[[File:MtlMetro1.svg|13px]] [[Line 1 Green (Montreal Metro)|Green Line]] |architect= LongprÃ©, Marchand, Goudreau, Dobush, Stewart, et Bourke |artist=[[Jean Cartier]] |depth=12.2 metres |depth-rank=42nd deepest |traffic= 2,203,624 entrances in 2006 |traffic-rank=41st busiest |distances= 781.69 metres to [[Assomption (Montreal Metro)|Assomption]]
518.51 metres to [[Langelier (Montreal Metro)|Langelier]] |addresses= 5995, [[Sherbrooke Street|rue Sherbrooke est]]
3315, [[de Cadillac Street|rue de Cadillac]] |intersections= rue Sherbrooke est / rue de Cadillac[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Cadillac.pdf Cadillac Station Neighbourhood Map] |}} '''Cadillac''' is a [[metro station|station]] on the [[Line 1 Green (Montreal Metro)|Green Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]] operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is in the district of [[Mercier, Quebec (district)|Mercier-Ouest]] in the borough of [[MercierâHochelaga-Maisonneuve]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m21.htm Cadillac Metro Station] The station opened on June 6, 1976, as part of the extension of the Green Line to [[HonorÃ©-Beaugrand (Montreal Metro)|HonorÃ©-Beaugrand]]. == Overview == Designed by LongprÃ©, Marchand, Goudreau, Dobush, Stewart, et Bourke, it is a normal [[side platform]] station built in [[tunnel]]. The central [[Mezzanine (architecture)|mezzanine]] gives access to the entrances diagonally across from one another at the corner of rue de Cadillac and rue Sherbrooke. The hallways to these entrances feature complementary [[mural]]s by [[Jean Cartier]]. [[File:WTMTL T35 P1130384.JPG|thumb|left|[[Mural]]s by [[Jean Cartier]].]] {{clear left}} ==Origin of the name== This station is named for rue de Cadillac. [[Antoine Laumet de La Mothe, sieur de Cadillac|Antoine Laumet, dit de La Mothe sieur de Cadillac]] (1658–1730) was a colourful [[France|French]] explorer of [[New France]]. He founded [[Detroit, Michigan|Detroit]], [[Michigan]] and commanded it from 1701 to 1710. ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
